Message.Issue: Implement IDisposable on 'LineObject' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'RenderObject'. If 'LineObject' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Implement IDisposable on 'Telnet' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'TelnetClient'.
'ControlForm' contains field 'ControlForm.Window' that is of IDisposable type: 'MainWindow'. Change the Dispose method on 'ControlForm' to call Dispose or Close on this field.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SQLiteCommand.SQLiteCommand(string, SQLiteConnection)' in 'DatabaseMethods.AddObject(int)' could contain the following variables 'countObjectView', '...', '...', '...', '...', '...', '...'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

The query string passed to 'SQLiteCommand.SQLiteCommand(string, SQLiteConnection)' in 'DatabaseMethods.AddObject(int)' could contain the following variables 'countObjectView', 't.Name', 't.Mass', 't.Radius'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SQLiteCommand.SQLiteCommand(string, SQLiteConnection)' in 'DatabaseMethods.GetSimulation(int)' could contain the following variables 'simulationId', 'simulationId'. Rule.Name: Avoid uncalled private code
Rule.Description: There is uncalled code that is not externally visible and is not a known runtime entry point. If this violation fires in error, please send a problem report to the Visual Studio Code Analysis team.

Rule.Name: Disposable fields should be disposed
Rule.Description: If a type that implements IDisposable owns fields that also implement IDisposable, the encapsulating type's Dispose() implementation should call Dispose() on each disposable field.
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains field {1} that is of IDisposable type: {2}. Change the Dispose method on {0} to call Dispose or Close on this field.

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}.
